review: I like the USB plug in so there's one less AC cord to cause an eyesore, but that's about the only perk over a standard Roku LT. I've been using Roku boxes since generation 1 and currently have LT's in the house with the exception of this stick.The remote not needing line of sight would be nice if it worked consistently. Unfortunately the remote functionality is choppy and inconsistent. The interface itself is not as reliable as the standard Roku either. Much more prone to freezing up, and the bummer is the rebooting process on the stick requires either turning the TV off or unplugging the tiny cord from the stick or USB port on the back of your TV (if the stick is powered from the TV's USB input). Next time I'll just get a regular Roku and deal with the cords...
